tit.e: Shigoto hajime (the first business day of the year)
tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。
tit.e: Shigoto hajime (the first business day of the year)

sen.j: 仕事始め（しごとはじめ）とは、1月2日に年が明けて初めて仕事をすること。
sen.e: "Shigoto hajime" means working on January 2, for the first time in the new year.
"Shigoto hajime" means working on January 2, for the first time in the new year.
"Shigoto hajime" means working on January 2, for the first time in the new year.

sen.j: 1月2日には普段の仕事を形だけ行い、その年の労働の安全や技能の上達を願う。
sen.e: On January 2, people only perform their usual tasks formally with the wish for safety in their work and improvement of their skills during the new year.
On January 2, people only perform their usual tasks formally with the wish for safety in their work and improvement of their skills during the new year.
sen.cmt: スペースの修正をしました。
sen.e: On January 2, people only perform their usual tasks formally with the wish for safety in their work and improvement of their skills during the new year.

sen.j: 農村では田畑に鍬を入れたり、縄作りの作業を始め、田の神を祀って米や餅などを供えた。
sen.e: In farm villages, people started hoeing paddy fields and making rice-straw ropes, performed a rite for the god of the paddy field, offering rice or mochi (rice cake).
In farm villages, people started hoeing paddy fields and making rice-straw ropes, performed a rite for tanokami (deity of rice fields and harvests), offering rice or mochi (rice cake).
sen.cmt: ”田の神”の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: In farm villages, people started hoeing paddy fields and making rice-straw ropes, performed a rite for tanokami (deity of rice fields and harvests), offering rice or mochi (rice cake).

sen.j: 山村では山の神を祀り、木の伐り初めを行った。
sen.e: In mountain villages, people performed a rite for the god of the mountain, starting cutting trees.
In mountain villages, people worshiped the god of the mountain, starting cutting trees.
sen.cmt: performed a rite for→worshiped と修正しました。
sen.e: In mountain villages, people worshiped the god of the mountain, starting cutting trees.

sen.j: 漁村では、船霊を祀って舟の乗り初めを行った。
sen.e: In fishing villages, people performed a rite for the spirit associated with seafaring, starting seafaring
In fishing villages, people worshiped the guardian deity of a ship, starting seafaring.
sen.cmt: performed a rite for→worshiped と修正しました。”船霊”の部分を修正しました。ピリオドを挿入しました。
sen.e: In fishing villages, people worshiped the guardian deity of a ship, starting seafaring.

sen.j: 商家では、初売や初荷が仕事始めに当たる。
sen.e: In merchant families, the first sale or delivery corresponds to "Shigoto hajime".
In merchant families, the first sale or shipment corresponds to "Shigoto hajime."
sen.cmt: delivery→shipment,ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: In merchant families, the first sale or shipment corresponds to "Shigoto hajime."

sen.j: 官公庁では毎年1月4日を官庁御用始めとして初めて執務を行う日としており、一般企業でもこれに準じていることが多い。
sen.e: In public offices, January 4 is the day they start work every year, called "Goyo hajime" (first business day of the year), and most companies follow this practice.
In government administration offices, January 4 is the day they start to work every year, called "Goyo hajime" (first business day of the year), and most companies follow this practice.
sen.cmt: public offices→government administration offices,to を挿入しました。
sen.e: In government administration offices, January 4 is the day they start to work every year, called "Goyo hajime" (first business day of the year), and most companies follow this practice.

sen.j: 昭和後期までは、和服を着て出社する場合もあった。
sen.e: Until the late Showa Period, some people went to work in kimono on the day.
Until the late Showa period, some people went to work in wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes) on the day.
sen.cmt: Period→period,”和服”の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: Until the late Showa period, some people went to work in wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes) on the day.
